title: (18600) Motril - 1 Río Guadiana
description: Laundromat.

title: (18600) Motril - 8 Rambla de las Brujas
description: Cheap automatic laundry in a commercial area with lots of parking

title: (18600) Motril - 15 Avenida de Salobreña
description: Alcampo supermarket car park. It's a big parking lot. We stayed one night and there was no problem, there were more motorhomes. Good parking for day and night parking. Limited to 4 t.

title: (18600) Motril - 14 Cañada Motril
description:
Underground parking 5 minutes from the entrance to downtown Motril.
No services.
Not made for sleeping

title: (18600) Motril - 124 Lugar Sg Mot
description:
A parking along the street. Busy and loud but good for leaving a car and seeing the city.
Staying over night is allowed however will not be pleasant due to noise.

title: (18600) Motril - 109 Avenida de Salobreña
description: Free water and air supply. At the Alcampo gas station.

title: (18600) Motril - 3A Calle Santo Domingo
description: Gas station with super adorable employees. We were allowed to fill ourselves with water. There is also the possibility to wash cars (unfortunately not mobile homes) and washing machines are also available. You can also empty the black water by refueling and requesting it from the vending machines.

title: (18600) Granada - 47D Diseminado la Nacla P2
description: Parking to spend the day with several outings to trails. It is conveniently parked and has picnic areas. A bit dirty and no bins. We do not see that it is a good area to spend the night, nor do we know if it can be. We see her a bit insecure depending on who you meet.

title: (18600) Motril - Unnamed Road
description:
Large, a bite abandoned parking lot with climbing crags nearby. Tricky access, be brave, it's worth of it.

WARNING: the barrier for animals can be opened and closed with no problem, there is an instruction on  board nearby. Just keep it closed

title: (18613) Motril - 49 Sus-Pue-1
description: Near the oil refinery. The place is a bit dusty but quiet, we are the only vehicle here at the moment and space would be for 10 vehicles.

title: (18613) Motril - 5 Calle Cebador
description: Empty industrial area.

title: (18613) Motril - 13 Agregado Puerto
description: Parking at the ticket office

title: (18613) Motril - 2 Camino del Pelaíllo
description:
Small car park right on the beach. Space for about 5 vans, I wouldn't recommend more than 6m. No prohibition sign. Small supermarket, pharmacy, restaurants in the immediate vicinity.
There is also a drinking fountain.

title: (18613) Motril - 70 Camino del Pelaíllo
description: Dirt parking, near the beach. to spend the night is not bad

title: (18600) Puntalón - 23 Calle Río Dauro
description: Rough parking area ok for large campers short walk to village

title: (18600) Puntalón - 1 Plaza Río Guadalquivir
description: Free parking in Puntalón, a very beautiful town in Motril, it has a fountain in the square, gardens and a very quiet area to spend the day, there is also a bar 100 meters from the square and a pharmacy! Trash bins, benches to rest and plenty of green areas.

name: Camping Playa de Poniente
title: (18613) Camping Playa de Poniente
description: Campsite Playa  dr Poniente near a very large, beautyful and guarded beach. Swimming pool very comfortable, with friendly lifeguards & aquaaerobic. Clean and large sanitaries. Minimarket and restaurant at front

title: (18613) Motril - 98 Camino del Pelaíllo
description: Small water fountain- ok to fill bottles. better than nothing.

title: (18610) Salobreña - Calle Espinar
description: Paved access road to farms and other areas of public services such as a dam

name: Camping Playa Granada
title: (18613) Camping Playa Granada
description: Camping Granada beach. To disconnect, very quiet, on the beach. All services and a small restaurant. A pool also, small, but to give you a soak it's not bad. Several beach bars nearby. At the foot of the promenade.

title: (18600) Puntalón - 1D Calle Río Guadalfeo
description: 24 hour parking... place to rest with the van or motorhome... Nearby there is a bar and supermarket. Drinking water fountain in the town square next to the Church.

title: (18720) Motril - 329 Lugar Sus Tor
description: Parking next to the beach

title: (18613) Motril - 130 Camino Peladillo
description:
Nice large parking area. Police check regularly, so don't try to outstay your welcome! just opposite the beach and beach bars. Hoyo 19 great cocktail! 
Very flat, plenty of places.  Cold shower on the beach. Great location, being looked over by the Sierra Mountains. 
Please respect this place before we lose all these beauty's!

title: (18613) Motril - 138 Camino Peladillo
description: parking area

title: (18720) Torrenueva - 3 Calle Juan Rulfo
description: Esplanade at the entrance of the town. It does not indicate a sign of not staying overnight and the police have seen me as I pass by and have not said anything. near the town.

title: (18613) Motril - 46 VI Playa Poniente
description: Sleep with your feet in the water lulled by the sound of the waves. Simple access. Limited to 2.10m. Choose your place in any case out of season (May). Small hut to drink aperitif or breakfast with your feet in the sand. Shower from the beach and toilet from the hut. Perfect

title: (18720) Torrenueva - 22 Carretera Almeria Perpd
description: Free parking 2 minutes walk from the beach, plenty of space. We did not spend the night but to leave the van for the day is great. Free public shower cabins 5 minutes on the beach.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 183 Urbanizacion Sue
description: Quiet parking lot with drinking water

title: (18680) Salobreña - 14 Avenida de Peronne
description: Parking on the street next to a school and an institute. Quiet, no noise and little traffic.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 337 Urbanizacion Sue
description: Site or side of the road to visit or pobo

title: (18680) Salobreña - 1 Avenida Nicaragua
description: Quiet parking at the entrance of Salobreña, next to a school, the street is illuminated and the parking lot is easy to get in and out, recommended for spending a night.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 59 Plaza Abastos
description: The Repsol petrol station with laundry service with 3x8kg, 2x14kg washing machines and 3x14 kg dryer. It takes 30min to wash or dry. It also offers blue LPG bottles and a station for washing pets. Washing cars / vans up to 2.90 m. A supermarket Maxi Dia is 50 meters away.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 2 Calle Joaquín Legaza
description: Parking to be calm and rest

title: (18680) Salobreña - 159 Avenida de Andalucía
description: Wide public parking on the street on the outskirts (illuminated). From this one has a beautiful view of the old town on a slope.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 37 Avenida de Andalucía
description: New very large parking area.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 4 Avenida de Andalucía
description: 100 m from the beach, we stayed the night there with other vans with no problem. Didn't felt insecure, police passed by and didn't said anything. Great alternative to Motril.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 391 Urbanización Sue-Te
description: Quiet place where you can sleep and park without paying, 200m from the beach and 400 from the center of Salobreña.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 6 Plaza Alcalde Juan Venegas
description: Ideal land area to visit the castle of Salobreña.

title: (18720) Torrenueva - 63 Calle Acera del Mar
description: Very quiet beachfront except in summer which is prohibited from June 15 to September 15

title: (18720) Motril - 3 Agregado Torrenueva
description: Large car park quick access to the center and the beach... possibility of sleeping, no ban

title: (18680) Salobreña - 13 Avenida de Andalucía
description: Online parking between a roundabout and some garbage cans. The avenue is wide and the sidewalk very wide, so you can get in and out of the vehicle without interrupting pedestrians. 2 minutes away you have the beach with bathrooms and showers. 15 minutes away is the town center. Bars and beach bars very close.

title: (18720) Torrenueva - 5 Calle Falúa
description: Free drinking water tap. Good access. Possible to connect a hose with universal adapter.

title: (18680) Salobreña - Unnamed Road
description: Municipal cemetery parking lot. quiet and with views of the town.

name: Área 340 TC Costa Tropical
title: (18720) Área 340 TC Costa Tropical
description: Welcome to Area340tc. Picnic area covered with branches and tables. Not far from the sea and restaurants. Evacuation (grey and black water) and supply (fresh water - drinking water) Laundry. Free WIFI.

title: (18680) Salobreña - 125 Urbanización Sue-Th1
description: Large gravel PP, right on the beach. Restaurants nearby. The ascent to the castle is worthwhile

title: (18680) Salobreña - 60 Urbanización Sue-Th1
description: Public parking, very large

title: (18680) Salobreña - 1 Plaza Guardia
description: Drinking water refill point.

title: (18600) Motril - N-340
description: A privileged site, difficult access, I do not recommend staying overnight, very uneven and lonely, dangerous place to go with children

title: (18600) Motril - 1D Calle Jayuyo
description: Free ample parking right next to the quite pretty beach if you close your eyes to the plastic polytunnels on one side. There doesn't seem to be any water at the moment but there are garbage cans.

title: (18730) - N-340
description: Plazoleta de carchuna, stop on your way to buy something in town and continue. you can spend the night.

title: (18616) Lagos - 22 Calle San Francisco
description: Parking in the square of this small town, away from the bustle of the coast. Very quiet, with beautiful views of both the mountains and the coast.

title: (18730) Motril - Camino Iryda
description: Parking facing the sea. Right next to La Perla cafe. Arrive late at the end of the day or early in the morning to find a place. Beach shower.

name: Camping Don Cactus Grupo Campingred
title: (18730) Camping Don Cactus Grupo Campingred
description: Camping Don Cactus. Environment plastic webs as far as the eye can see. Camping by the sea. Free Wifi. For a step.

title: (18730) - 1341B Diseminado el Cerrillo P41
description: Water pipe between the toilet and the lemon tree. Ask the station manager to let you know. We refilled our clean waters for free after refueling.

title: (18680) Salobreña - Km 323 Carretera de Almería
description: Access only for off-road vehicles. But here you are off the crowded tourist trails and have a beautiful bay to yourself. Parking a little above. Uneven.

title: (18680) Salobreña - Carretera de Almería
description: It is an area to stop and rest we have stopped to eat something and follow the route, very spacious.

title: (18730) Carchuna - 1451C Diseminado el Cerrillo P41
description: Castle of Carchuna

title: (18670) Vélez de Benaudalla -
description: Perfect place to spend the day by the river, a very quiet place on Saturdays and Sundays, 20 steps away there is a small dam where people share the day with their dogs and can bathe in peace, at night it is true that it is a bit lonely, with only orchard houses, but to enjoy a perfect day,

title: (18680) Velilla-Taramay - Carr. de Almería
description: It is right next to the road, to be passing through or at night (we arrived at 2:00 in the morning and left at 9:30 in the morning). Cars pass because it is right next to the road, but we were able to sleep without a problem.

title: (18670) Vélez de Benaudalla - Carretera Bailén-Motril
description: Shaded picnic area. room for spending the night. shaded and seating available.  room for bbq

title: (18730) Motril - 2 Calle Cueva Alcantara
description: Parking to spend the night in peace without opening windows

title: (18730) Calahonda - 8 Avenida de las Palmeras
description: Normal parking lot parking in line. There are bars nearby and a grocery store. You can spend a maximum of 48 hours as in the whole town.

title: (18612) Velilla-Taramay - Unnamed road
description: Quiet place with shade. We spent two nights and one day there without seeing anyone. 3G a little capricious, but sufficient.

title: (18730) Granada - 221 Diseminado el Palmar P41
description: This entire street is used as a parking lot for the adjacent pebble beach. There are outdoor showers on the beach (tall, not just for feet, but just to wash off with water, not soap/shampoo), which was the main reason we went to this beach.

title: (18730) Calahonda - 1A Calle Nautilus
description: Fountain for filling water canisters. Parking possible. Good water pressure

title: (18730) Calahonda - Travesía Ricardo León
description: Free parking, lit, in front of the beach with space for about 10-15 camper.

title: (18730) Calahonda - 2 Calle Rosales
description:
A water fountain like you see it everywhere in Spain.
It is located between the sports field and the promenade.
According to a local resident, the water comes from the Sierra Nevada.

Parking in the street possible without problems.

title: (18614) Gualchos -
description: Large platform overlooking the sea, reachable after a comfortable dirt road. 15 min from Rijana beach. Follow the instructions for Pico de l’Aguila. The place is very calm, we spent the night and just one bike passed the morning after. Suitable for vans. *please leave the place cleaner that you found it*♥️♻️

title: (18730) Calahonda -
description: Viewpoint with spectacular views of the sea. It has no shadow. Ideal for spending the night if you leave early at dawn.

title: (18614) Gualchos - Carretera de Almería
description: We always spend one night here has never been a problem. Beautiful view.

title: (18690) Almuñécar - Rambla de Cobrio
description:
Busy beach with bars and restaurants.
Definitely not for large vehicles, but possible with a small van.
There are two long-established restaurants. Garbage disposal is available. toilet was locked

title: (18612) Ítrabo - 1 Barrio Ue 1
description: Large esplanade where to park, without services. A very beautiful town to visit, especially its Mudejar-style church, you can also start the route of León el a African, climb to the Picacho and the source. The town has shops, bars, a pharmacy and a sports center with a swimming pool.

title: (18670) Vélez de Benaudalla - 128 A-346
description: Large parking at the lake, nice view. Possibility of spending the night, no prohibition sign.

title: (18615) Granada - GR-3204
description: Very nice place with a great view of the sea, concrete floor, no service, very quiet in December, 1 car per hour

title: (18614) Gualchos - 328 N-340
description: Parking by the beach with a beautiful bridge below an incredible cove

title: (18670) Vélez de Benaudalla -
description: Perfect for a chill spot, unreal view of the mountains and dam!

title: (18690) Velilla-Taramay - 1A Camino de la Galera
description: Beach for children due to its shallow depth, it has a road very close where there is free parking, a park with a beautiful pine forest right on the beach

title: (18614) Gualchos - Carretera de Almería
description: Quiet place overlooking the sea, has a bit of unevenness. We had an uneventful night. Being a weekday there was not much movement on the road.

name: Viña Castilla
title: (18614) Viña Castilla
description: The Viña Castilla motorhome park is located about 3 km from the town of Castell de Ferro. In the caravan park we have a shower with hot running water, toilets, washing machine and electricity for 5 caravans. And a newly built petanque court! A 2-minute walk from the car park is our restaurant, where you can enjoy a drink and homemade and grilled dishes next to a roaring fireplace.

title: (18400) Órgiva - A-346
description: Idyllic place directly on the barrier lake with room for 1-2 cars. It is a bit tricky to position the car so that it is on the good level. The path is partially rinsed off - ground clearance is an advantage - but not absolutely necessary for experienced drivers. If doubt, check out the last part of the path by foot.

title: (18400) Órgiva - A-346
description: Good overnight spot adjacent to local road, not very busy. Waterfront can be reached with small walk. Tarmac standing some of it is level.

title: (18418) Los Tablones -
description:
Quite place in the montains, with good protection from the winds.
Next to some abandoned mines, which you can explore.
To get there you will need 4wd, and your vehicle should not be much bigger than a VW van.

name: Área de autocaravana en Almuñecar
title: (18690) Área de autocaravana en Almuñecar
description: Open again all year!! Motorhome area 4 minutes walk from the beach, restaurants and supermarket. Quiet space.

title: (18660) Acebuches - A-346
description: Small slightly sloping gravel area, just good for a meal break. Nice view but some traffic to remember. After dinner we left

title: (18614) Gualchos -
description:
Not the prettiest place, but much more sheltered from the road than the others spots around.
The path is a little rocky but nothing bad.
Tons of space and just the right sight to see the sun rise above the sea

title: (18400) Órgiva - A-346
description: We didn't land there, but at the spot just below. It was during a walk that we discovered this place, there are beehives and it's very cute! The Lake is not accessible.

title: (18615) Los Guajares - GR-4300
description: Aera recreational Los Guajares. Small car park near the area which has benches, table, barbecues and waterfall. Prohibited at the campsite. Road passes near the car park but not very busy. Access for 2 to 3 vehicles maximum. I advise against those over 7m.

title: (18660) Acebuches -
description: Under the bridge. flat and spacious place. very quiet, with nice views. You can take shelter from the wind with the pillars of the bridge.

title: (18400) El Cuervo de Sevilla - Autovía Sierra Nevada-Costa Tropical
title_short: (18400) El Cuervo de Sevilla - Autovía Sierra Nevada-Costa Tropical
description: Very nice view of dam, just under the viaduct, next to the winddurf club. but not too noisy as it is in October, not too much passage. You can swim, but the banks are very steep.

name: Camping Tropical
title: (18690) Camping Tropical
description: Campsite close to town. Quiet, small, familiar and overlooking the Cherimoya Valley. Come and enjoy the beautiful views of Almunecar, the plain of Rio Verde with tropical fruit trees, the mountains and the sea. The center and the beach are within walking distance of 1 kilometer.

title: (18400) Órgiva -
description: Site overlooking the swamp, difficult access for caravans and large vans. To put some downside, the highway passes right over it but it is not annoying. We have had a good night. You have to follow the path that gives access to the surf school.

title: (18699) Jete, Granada -
description: Small area just for eating. 3G hard tables available

title: (18400) Órgiva - A-346
description: Beautiful place near the road in the middle of nature, overlooking the reservoir, near a house in ruins. Only 4x4.

title: (18614) Castell de Ferro - 3 GR-5209
description: BP gas station with LPG and water and air terminal which allowed us to fill our water

title: (18614) Castell de Ferro - 2 Carretera Malaga
description: Zone Tropic Autocaravanas - Fully equipped car park with a large supply and disposal area, men's and women's toilets, showers, sink area, washing machine and dryer. 50-200m from the beach. The baker comes every morning (except Sunday). A DIA convenience store is 500m away. French owners.

title: (18614) Castell de Ferro - GR-5209
description: Laundry neat and clean, clothes dryer, good free Wi-Fi, parking along the road, prices March 2019.

title: (18400) Órgiva - A-346
description: Free ground parking near the road. Little noisy at night, but beautiful views compensate it. No services around.

name: Área Camper Castell
title: (18740) Área Camper Castell
description: NEW. Parking for caravans and motorhomes located in Castell de Ferro. Newly built and located next to the beach. We have an independent electricity and water outlet, access to bathrooms and showers, a Wi-Fi area and a laundry area. In addition to washer and dryer service, sink and gray water emptying.

title: (18740) Castell de Ferro - 9 Calle Carlos Cano
title_short: (18740) Castell de Ferro - 9 Calle Carlos Cano
description: Public parking lot

name: Camping Huerta Romero en Granada
title: (18740) Camping Huerta Romero en Granada
description: Camping Huerta Romero. Shady place with 10 meters to the beach. We were greeted warmly and since it was the off-season we were allowed to park the trailer in a second place. Restaurants around the corner. Place and the sanitary facilities are well maintained and clean.

title: (18740) Castell de ferro - N-340
description: Large esplanade overlooking the sea by the road. Stable soil. Relatively flat if you choose your location well, otherwise you have to plan to stall (seriously). Two stone tables and two bins available. The area is clean, superb view. The road is not at all inconvenient. Sound of waves and wind. We had a very good night. Hassle-free access with a large template. Be careful if you arrive at night with a dog: the access to the cliff is not entirely protected and we had a visit from a deer…

title: (18740) Gualchos - 10 Poligono Industrial Castell
description: The best gas station in Spain. The most friendly girl works here in the night. You can buy lot of different things like in the supermarket and very cheap! And I got very good help in the night when I needed gas for my camper. Thanks for saving me!

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 2 Calle Cristóbal Colón
description: 24-hour laundromat. New and clean. Very efficient and reasonable prices. Payment in coins or banknotes  2 electrical outlets for recharging telephones or batteries.

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 10 Carretera de Málaga -Velilla
description: Public parking, quiet place, lots of shade and no services. Closed on Fridays because of the weekly market.

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 2 Camino Real de Motril
description: Service station with the possibility of taking water (not drinking water) In the region it is a plus because it is not easy to find water to fill up the motorhome

title: (18740) Castell de Ferro - 18 Camino Real
description: Large car park at the entrance to the beach. Access is on the side of the building a street that goes down to go to the football field. head all the way to the beach, the parking lot is there. police passed by without saying anything . to sleep there was a party suddenly it was quite noisy with the music, but it may not be every day, to see

title: (18614) Lújar - 23 Calle Diamante
description: Beachfront parking, possible during the day.

title: (18615) Guájar-Alto - Unnamed Road
description: Nice quiet place - we stayed there with our VW bus

title: (18698) Otívar - Unnamed Road
description:
Difficult access area, but with a little dexterity you can get there. only a few meters of path with difficulty.
amazing views. with tables and viewing areas.
alone to sleep late.
only two vans.
tall and wide motorhomes do not enter.
vans l2h2 yes.

title: (18698) Otívar - 52 A-4050
description: Strong slope to access. quiet and illuminated place Free.

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 3 Avenida Amelia Sánchez de Alcázar
title_short: (18690) Almuñécar - 3 Avenida Amelia Sánchez de Alcázar
description: Parking on the public highway payable by the hour but no problem to renew, every three hours. Quiet street, very close to the beach in front of a Mercadona and a summer cinema. No service, large avenue, easy access

title: (18400) Fregenite -
description: Level place, great view, steep approach with up to 15% gradient. In the middle of nowhere, but the access road is also for the small mountain village of Olías, so one or the other car will come by.

title: (18711) Rubite - Carretera de Almería
description: It is a small parking lot next to the national 340a, with very beautiful views of the town, we stopped, the waves of the sea could be heard and a car pass by from time to time. No services

title: (18711) Rubite - 20 Calle Carretera
description: Rubite local car park, at the entrance to the pretty mountain village. Situated on the edge of the Sierra Nevada at an altitude of approx. 800m with breathtaking views of the valley and the sea. There is a bar in town, but no permanent shopping facilities. Right next to the car park is the village park and outdoor sports equipment, as seen in many places in Spain.

title: (18711) Rubite - 14 Calle Carretera
description: Public toilet with the possibility of taking water for showers, provide a container but it helps, especially in the mountains without water

title: (18400) Órgiva - 1080 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Lovely spot next to a dry river bed. Drive 2 km from the road on a dirt road and park. Excellent walks. On the green and white walking route.

title: (18418) - 763 Diseminado Diseminados
description: El Morreon is a long dirt track with many trucks and vans parked on private land, but there is a strip of land here beside the river that's flat and with nice view down valley of Sierra Lujar. Trucks longer then 8m may have problems getting around two corners on the narrow paved road before you get to the 500m dirt track part. 25 min walk into town, nice to park here as many travellers/van dwellers in area! Stock up on water before you get here as that river water is not for drinking!

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 11G Paseo de Cotobro
description: Quiet place, around 8 o'clock you can hear people walking but as in any promenade. beachfront parking with shower and toilet at 20m. on the same road there are more parking spots.

title: (18711) Rubite - A-4131
description: Fantastic parking and overnight stay on a small, bypassed road. Here you have both: a view of the sea and the peaks of the Sierra Nevada, still snow-covered in April. Anyone who loves solitude and tranquility will feel particularly at home here.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 6 A-346
description: Beautiful place next to the bridge: ‘Puente de los siete ogos’. Next to a little road and some traffic at night, but not bothersome. Next to a little river. Perfect place to camp very near to Orgiva!

title: (18400) Órgiva -
description: Not bad

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 10 Paseo de Cotobro
description: Right at the end of Cotobro beach and where the naturist beach of El Muerto begins. Small parking area for vans, no AC. There is a shower on the beach, at the beginning of the beach there is a public bathroom and changing room. A restaurant in the area. Very quiet out of season. Very crowded in summer time.

name: Camping Órgiva
title: (18418) Camping Órgiva
description: Small quiet campsite in the Alpujarra, at the foot of the Veleta

title: (18711) Rubite - A-4131
description: Large flat site next to the road. The altitude of around 1000m guarantees a night with a pleasant temperature even in the middle of summer. There is a nice view of the village of Rubite and down to the sea. There is some traffic on the road around but only a few cars per hour pass by, nothing to disturb.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - A-348
description:
Beautiful view and lots of flat ground if parked next to either of the wind turbines. 
Road going to windmill is steep but sturdy. No good parking space right next to the road. Not much sound from road. Constant sound from windmills if it’s windy.

title: (18400) orgiva - 181 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Motorhome area in the heart of the Alpujarra just 1 hour from the snow and 30 minutes from the beach with incredible views and a quiet area emptying gray water only for customers

title: (18400) Órgiva - 95 Calle Parrapa
description: Fairly large esplanade.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - A-348
description: Leisure and picnic area in front of Lance. You spend the night on the road ... but at night there is no traffic.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 2 Calle Vicente Aleixandre
description: Faucet with good pressure, without hook to connect hose, easy to park in a very quiet street but very inclined

title: (18420) Lanjarón - 16 Calle Salado
description: Castle Car Park. 150 metres from road. Entrance a little narrow at one point near the bottom so check first if you have a large camper. Lots of room to turn around in the car park. There is no sign saying camping not allowed. Beautiful spot with great views and benches to sit on. Shaded on one side with medium size trees.

name: Camping Puerta de la Alpujarra
title: (18418) Camping Puerta de la Alpujarra
description: RV parking on a series of separate gravel levels. Each floor faces south and offers unobstructed views over the valley and the opposite hill. Each pitch has free electricity and plenty of space. Several blocks of toilets and showers are very clean and in good condition. There are washing-up areas and a free washing machine in each block. The only problem is that there is no dedicated service room to drain gray water, empty toilet cassettes or refill water. Cassettes can be emptied in the toilet block and there is an outside tap on the toilet block. If there was a special service area.

title: (18418) Órgiva - 40a A-348
description: Laundromat opposite supermarket Dia

title: (18400) Órgiva - 49 Calle Vera
description: Drinking water tap

title: (18420) Lanjarón - Calle Variante
description: Large parking lot. Convenient to access the main street, no services, suitable for large motorhomes

title: (18418) Órgiva - 39 Calle Vera
description: Parking in a street between the river and the sports complex. Very quiet, alternative and within walking distance of the village.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 18 Calle Jesus y Maria
description: Quiet big parking place in the center of the town. Suitable for big camper vans like ours (almost 8 metres). A few olive trees for some shade in the summer. No facilities. Bakery very nearby, at the other side of the street

title: (18400) Órgiva - 11 Calle Cristo de la Expiración
title_short: (18400) Órgiva - 11 Calle Cristo de la Expiración
description: Private guarded car park. only for small campers.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - A-348
description: It is a parking lot that is a little before entering the town. It does not have any type of service. It is next to the road but at night there is little traffic and it sleeps well. After seeing the other two options we prefer to stay here. One is very steep and another is on the same street as the town next to the sidewalk. Large motorhomes may something fair.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 1 Calle Fuente Mariano
description: Washing center near a CEPSA service station.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - Calle Variante
description: A public car park with capacity of about 10 meters long, and many others of normal dimensions, in all the center of the village and with these views, easy access. Of course, without services, it seems a quiet place to spend the night.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 140 Calle Lora Tamayo
description: Parking lot with bins and children's playground. Not sure if the overnight stay is okay. I didn't see any parking signs at all.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - A-348
description: Drinking water without chlorine. Easy to fill, also big watertanks.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - 2 Calle Variante
description: Parking in the street variant, roadside.

title: (18420) Lanjarón - 14 Avenida García Nájera
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (18420) Lanjarón - 3 Avenida de Madrid
description: Public apartment

title: (18400) Órgiva - 10 Calle Ramon y cajal
description: Big asfalt parking lot.

title: (18656) Lecrín - Carretera Bailén-Motril
description: Nice place for a snack break, overnight stay not recommended because the viaduct above is a source of noise when passing trucks.

title: (18711) Rubite - 6 Calle Costa de Rubite
description: Abandoned campsite, but where people still come during the summer.  A quiet place with friendly locals.  There are no camp services, so please pick up your trash behind you. Please check the last photo to understand the entrance for larger campers it may be a skill exercise :)

title: (18656) Lecrín - Unnamed Road
description: Zone very quiet swamp with park, the access is narrow.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 7 Calle Bancal de la Cruz
title_short: (18400) Órgiva - 7 Calle Bancal de la Cruz
description: Verry nice Parking. Located in the city with all shops and close to the Thursday market!

title: (18418) Órgiva - 24 GR-4202
description: Place to park or spend the night near Orgiva. there is space for 1 or 2 campers just off the road, where we stayed for 2 nights with no problems. There are no facilities as it is just a dirt parking lot in the mountains. You can also move further down the road to the river to look for other spots, but this is best suited for lighter vans or motorhomes that are suitable for off-road use.

title: (18400) Órgiva - 3 Calle Beber
description: Relatively large parking lot, which is a bit greener than the others in the city. No camping forbidden sign and very little frequented. Unfortunately it was extremely noisy in the morning and the place seems to be a popular dog meadow, which is why it is quite full of dog pepikaka.

title: (18697) Almuñécar - 2 Calle Cuesta de la Negrita
title_short: (18697) Almuñécar - 2 Calle Cuesta de la Negrita
description: Parking next to the beach.

name: Camping Castillo de Baños
title: (18750) Camping Castillo de Baños
description: Close to La Mamola and another small village. Tapas bars and restaurants nearby. Nice area which is not suitable for tourists. The site is a bit rustic but a good winter site.

title: (18656) Lecrín - 306 Carretera Beznar
description: Site to spend day night, it is a stretch of unused road, it is paved, care must be taken when entering only one part with concrete, the other part a strong step, being careful, it is a very good area to sleep,

title: (18420) Lanjarón - 111 Calle Señor de la Expiración
title_short: (18420) Lanjarón - 111 Calle Señor de la Expiración
description: Water from a fountain by the roadside, lots of space to pull in and park up while filling

title: (18697) Almuñécar - 5 Plaza Manuel Rodríguez el Ruso
title_short: (18697) Almuñécar - 5 Plaza Manuel Rodríguez el Ruso
description: Gas station with water (not potable) and air

title: (18656) Lecrín - 300 Carretera Beznar
description: Parking bay for a maximum of two vehicles with a view of olive trees above a reservoir. Beautiful evening panorama.

name: Cámper La Herradura
title: (18697) Cámper La Herradura
description: Overnight area for Motorhomes. Very close to the beach (on the street before the promenade). If you want to get there without getting lost, visit the contact tab on our website. Located in the center of the city. Opened in August 2022.

title: (18418) Cáñar - GR-4201
description: Beautiful valley with an old friendly hippy community. Respect this place as well as its inhabitants the possibility of rendering services and making beautiful meetings. Hikes are a must because the place is wonderful. If you meet people who are hitchhiking take them they will be happy to show you the way :) good ballad

title: (18400) - 24 Diseminado Diseminados
description:
*OBLIGATORY TO CONTACT US TO BOOK A PLACE*
We like to offer you the space to reconnect to the purity and peace of nature, and welcome you to camp or park on our 1,5 hectare land. The property offers many spots for camping, covered by the shade of old trees. 

We offer the following to aid your stay:

- beautiful private spot to pitch your tent or to park 
- Use of communal kitchen. Please keep it clean!
- cold shower
-drinking water
- compost toilet
-plug to charge a phone or electricity for basic use only


We do NOT provide:
-electricity connection to cars or vans
- possibility to dump black water

Price:
10 euros/night/person
 5 euros/night for every additional person in the same tent or van

Example:
2 people sharing 1 tent or van =15 euros
2 people each in own tent or van=20 euros

We do not accept dogs or other pets, as we have 4 chickens, 1 cat and 2 dogs and like to keep the sensitive and peaceful balance between all animals. Thank you for your understanding.

title: (18697) Almuñécar - 42 Paseo Andrés Segovia
description: Unpeved road perpendicular to the front beach street! There are signs everywhere, except here!

title: (18710) Polopos -
description: Small esplanade next to a practically unused road, spectacular views, we had wind at night but you sleep well, without services. The road to get there is well paved, suitable for all types of camper/AC.

name: Camping Cerro Gordo
title: (18690) Camping Cerro Gordo
description: NUEVO CAMPING LA HERRADURA located at the end of the promenade with many trees, medium plots, clean but old toilets, do not accept cards, very quiet 20% discount in low season

title: (18418) Cáñar - GR-4201
description:
Large parking area next to HeliPad 1km from Cañar village. 
Next to the road, but its not busy and very quiet during the night.
Beautiful Sunset views.

title: (18658) Melegís - 36 Al Virillas de Rondan
description: Drinking water fountain next to a play park, and mirador.

title: (18418) Cáñar - 7 Las Eras
description: A large parking lot. is in the mountains, very steep and winding driveway. The entrance to the parking lot is narrow and very steep. recommended only with small van (maximum size T4 or Caddy)

title: (18400) Órgiva - A-348
description: Small gravel square below the road in the middle of a pine forest. The main road is 20m away but you can hardly hear the cars and it is very little used. We spent a quiet night there. Place accessible by motorhome.

title: (18699) Otívar - A-4050
description: Pitch with space for two campers, on the side of the road. Stunning view over the valley. Great place to start hiking. Silent and starry night. This is one of the few places where 4G gets.

title: (18697) Almuñécar - 4 Poligono Plan Parcial P10
description: Parking along the street. Spent 3 nights completely alone in the off-season. Fantastic sunrise with a view of La Herradura. Fairly straight parking lots. Steep driveway but all paved. Right next to the road but little traffic

title: (18690) Almuñécar - 23 Calle Encina
description:
Parking with breathtaking views of La Herradura. Beautiful flat location.
Space for maximum three cars, with one more a little higher up.
Please respect the locals and the neighborhood. Don't leave any rubbish!

title: (18656) Lecrín - 23 Calle la Constitución
description: Gas station with drinking water

title: (18438) La Umbría - A-348
description: Old section of road...

title: (18659) Albuñuelas - 12 Calle Carretera
description: A central and almost unique place where you can park in the village. there are beautiful roads along the river.

title: (18410) Granada - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful view of 4 villages lit up at night on the mountainside. Place for 2 vehicles

title: (18410) Soportújar - A-4132
description: Esplanade where you can park. Perfect to see Withstand.

title: (18410) Soportújar - 36 Calle Alta
description: Parking Soportujar. Bruges village. Right next to the "Era of the covens" Indicated at the entrance of the Town. You have to climb a very steep and narrow slope. Not suitable for motorhomes. Down to the pool there are toilets and a great bar for lunch or dinner. A magical town!

title: (18656) Lecrín - 35 N-323a
description: Parking for one night, quiet and safe.

title: (18410) Soportújar - Calle Carretera
description:
Parking for motorhomes on a dirt esplanade, about 700 m from the town. Ideal for visiting the town and as we were informed by those in charge of its management and collection of the money, you can spend the night without problems.

It is quite flat, no need for shims

title: (18410) Granada - Carretera, Polígono 4 Parcela 125
description: Parking next to the road and 500 meters from Soportujar. Passage of cars, but a good place to spend some time or spend the night. There is room for about 3 AC of 7 or more meters.

title: (18410) Soportújar - 6 Calle Alta
description: Paid parking area in the same town. It has closing hours (chain). we have entered without problems with a l3h2 (6m) but not valid for a motorhome of more than 6:40.approx.

title: (18697) La Herradura - 59B Diseminado Cerro Gordo Pol 37
title_short: (18697) La Herradura - 59B Diseminado Cerro Gordo Pol 37
description: Lookout on the cliffs of Cerro Gordo, on a back road with no traffic. There are several in the area. Fantastic view of the cliffs. Without services

title: (18410) Soportújar - 17 Calle Carretera
description: Fountain

title: (18690) Almuñécar - Carretera de Almería
description: Parking for 10 or 12 Motorhomes. Next to the road. Soil without slope Access to nude beach with two restaurants

title: (18697) Playa Cantarriján - 72A Diseminado Cantarrijan Pol 37
description: Parking next to the beach. There is space for around 15 motorhomes. In summer it is not allowed to go down with the motorhome (there is a closed barrier) in low season it is a very comfortable place. There are two restaurants on the beach which provide good food. The bathrooms in the restaurant are open. The barraca restaurant is open all year round. In the restaurant there is the possibility of taking a paying shower

title: (18697) La Herradura - Carr. de Almeria
description: Quiet parking lot, but slightly inclined.

title: (18656) Lecrín - 69 N-323a
description: At the foot of an impressive wind turbine. In the middle of the almond trees. And a view of the river and the lake. Perfect.

title: (18410) Soportújar -
description: Incredible spot on the way up to the Buddhist center. unbeatable views. silence and full nature.

title: (29780) Nerja - Carretera de Almería
description: Medium size car park on the cliffs, long steep walking track down to a beautiful cove beach, lots of fish in crystal clear sea. There is a bus to take you up and down the hill. Night prohibited.

title: (18410) Soportújar -
description: Place with beautiful views at the foot of a Buddhist temple, access by dirt track, to go up with a good Camper, with difficult AC.

title: (18659) Albuñuelas - Carril Forestal
description: Silence total beautiful view to leave clean I curse you

title: (18430) Torvizcón - 3 Calle Carretera
description: Small gas station outside the Town. There are not many around the area and it took us out of a hurry

title: (29780) Nerja - 132 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Small flat parking area slightly off the road next to a large water tank 50m after the tarmac runs out. Great panoramic views down to the coast. Very small road to get there which was tricky in a small campervan and probably wouldn't be possible for anything larger.

title: (18699) Lentegí -
description:
Beautiful little clearing between the trees with 2 or 3 level spots. There are 2 access paths, we recommend taking the second across from the unfinished house because of the trees. A little bumpy but doable. 

The clearing is between the main road and a few houses. In the morning and in the afternoon, a few cars drove by. Other than that, there was absolute tranquility. We were there for 3 days without a problem.

There is almost no 4G in the whole park, but here there is a little bit. Just enough to send messages with some patience. 

Please keep the place clean :)

title: (18656) Acequias - 1 Calle Valle Lecrin
description: Level place at the beginning of the place. Various bins for waste sorting on site

title: (18430) Torvizcón - 7 Calle Carretera
description: Large flat parking below the street in the lower town, just above the pool. Perfect for a night's sleep, very quiet, no problem.

title: (18411) Pampaneira - A-4132
description: Parking (approx. 1150m above sea level) near a gas station. There's a toilet and water, not drinkable. Great view and very quiet at night.

title: (18710) Alfornón - GR 5204
description: Struggled to find anywhere near and came across this lay by. Beautiful spot one car every two hours flat and perfect big enough for for 7 metres only one spot

title: (29787) Maro -
description: Parking at the Cala del Pino naturist beach.

title: (18659) - 1 Calle Huertecillas
description: Parking next to the sports center of Cónchar. There are no services, only bins and a tap to get water. 100 meters away you will find a restaurant and a youth hostel with a restaurant serving typical dishes of the Lecrin Valley, quite recommendable. The city is beautiful, with spectacular views and nearby hiking trails. On leaving, possible emptying in the service station La Loma.
